It involves the observation and measurement of celestial objects, including stars, planets, galaxies, and other phenomena. The field of astronomy is divided into several subfields, including astrophysics, planetary science, stellar astronomy, and cosmology. Astronomy is the study of celestial objects, space, and the universe as a whole. It involves the observation, measurement, and analysis of celestial bodies, such as stars, galaxies, planets, and comets. Astronomers use a range of techniques, including telescopes, spacecraft, and computer simulations, to gather data and develop theories about the origin and evolution of the universe. By studying astronomy, scientists can gain insights into the fundamental laws of physics and the nature of time and space. The field of astronomy is constantly evolving, with new discoveries and advancements in technology leading to a deeper understanding of the cosmos. By exploring the universe, astronomers can uncover the secrets of the cosmos and expand our knowledge of the universe. The study of astronomy is an ongoing endeavor, with new discoveries and findings continually shaping our understanding of the universe.
